intro: Dyschoriste tenera, commonly known as the slender dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs. Dyschoriste tenera is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
